intro: Grewia pondoensis, commonly known as the Pondo bush, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its fruit is a dry, woody capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Grewia pondoensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
